"huh?" you instinctively tilt your head to the right in a curious fashion as you gaze upon the strange charm. Just by gazing down at it, you quickly estimate that the stone must've been about half your size in both height and length, or at least that's what it seemed like.

Unsure of just what this strange artifact was, let alone what it was doing on the floor, you slowly extend your furred hand out to place it upon the solid surface. At first nothing seemed to happen as your hand was adorned upon the rough textured rock, but in just a matter of moments you suddenly begin to feel a strange surge of energy begin to enter straight from within your hands. Startled by the sudden feeling, you quickly retract your hand back only to shockingly realize that the strange feeling continued to course down your arm and soon your entire body as well. In just moments, the odd surge causes your entire body to momentarily shudder as if your entire form was altering once again.
15521.title: Your clothes shrunk with you.

15522.title: You shrunk right out of your clothes!

155221.content:
It had only been a few moments since you stepped on the strange stone, and suddenly you found yourself disoriented and buried underneath some kind of heavy fabric. You crawled around underneath the fabric trying to find a way out, and eventually emerged out from underneath it and stood up. Able to see now, you realized the thing you had been stuck under had been the shirt you were wearing, and you were now standing on top of it in only your bare fur naked as the day you were born. You were only about six inches tall now, barely much bigger than a mouse, not a respectable size for a cat.

You looked around the room, everything was so much bigger now. You were still inside the house, and now it seemed to be a lot more menacing. Broken floorboards and small holes that were beneath your notice previously were now large enough to to be actual pitfalls. The legs of chairs stretched high above your head, and you had no hopes of seeing what was on top of shelves or tables.

You stumbled down from atop the shirt you had been wearing and nearly tripped as your feet touched down onto the wooden floor. It had seemed pretty smooth earlier but now it was a rugged full of ridges that felt rough beneath your pawpads. Sitting next to your discarded clothes on this floor you saw something else. A shiny perfectly smooth black stone. This was the stone you had stepped on without noticing earlier. Now the stone sitting on the ground was almost as tall as your waistline.

It seemed the rumor about magical artifacts in this house were true! But you hadn't expected to get shrunk like this without warning! Maybe the stone could also reverse it? Or it could be even more dangerous to work with.

You stare at the stone for a moment, your little kitten brain thinking about what the best option was.
155221.title: Shrunken in the House

1552211.content:
They do say curiosity killed the cat.

Here's hoping that doesn't turn out to be the truth today.

Despite the fact that the strange black stone is clearly magical and dangerous since it had shrunk you down to a mere six inches tall when you first stepped on it, you decided the best course of action was to poke at the stone. You slowly edged up to the stone walking on the tips of your toes as your tail was held perfectly still in tension. Your ears folded back against your head and every hair on your body stood on edge. You managed to avoid hissing at the stone as you examined its smooth surface, your face now a mere inch from it.

Wait that wasn't right.

If you were full size you would have been an inch away, but now it was a distance much closer than an inch because you were so small.

You tried to math it out in the head. Carried the one... Divide by something..

Aha! You figured it out!

It was a somethingorother away from your face!

That out of the way you finally let your curiosity take over as you reached out a pawlike hand and batted at the stone.
1552211.title: Clearly This Will End Well

15522111.content:
You touch the stone with your handpaws and feel its perfectly smooth service under your pawpads. Even at this shrunken size you couldn't find a single crack or ridge along the stone. As you examined it you felt a slight tinge that started with your paws on the stone and quickly made its way through your entire body. Suddenly, the stone was getting bigger. Really though that wasn't it, you were getting even smaller.

You let out a surprised meow as your feline form started to dwindle even more. How could you have not seen this coming?

You pulled your hands back away from the stone, this was less due to you trying to pull away really fast and more due to the fact the stone was suddenly taller than you and you just couldn't keep your hands on top of it. You stumbled backwards away from the stone landing on your bottom as you stared up at it. At one point this thing had been small enough to accidentally step on without noticing, now it was bigger than you.

The twinging feeling in your body was slowly starting to fade. This time the stone had shrunken you all the way down to..
15522111.title: How Totally Unexpected!

choices: Explore the House in Search of Artifacts
Escape the house before anything else happens!
1552212.content:
Considering that just touching the stone had made you so tiny, you decided that maybe it wasn't the best idea to mess with it. Sure, touching it again -might- undo the shrinking... But it might make you even smaller. Just to be on the safe side, you quickly scampered away from the strange stone as well as your previously fitted clothing.

But if you weren't going to mess with the stone, now what? You looked around the old house. If it had been intimidating before, now it was overbearing. It was like being in an entirely new world, full of giant broken furniture, stairs with each step taller than you, and cobwebs that could cover your entire body. Those were cobwebs right? Your ears flattened slightly as you thought about the possibility of encountering spiders like this. You were still bigger than most spiders but... It was still a situation you'd rather avoid.

You took a few steps back towards the house entrance, slowly approaching the stairs as another problem dawned on you. At your size, getting around in the house, or really anywhere was going to be a real problem. It wasn't as if the walk home would be any easier, but there were probably less things that could curse you on the way home.

Then again, if you found a stone that shrunk you, it was entirely possible there might be another artifact in the house that could make you bigger. Of course, it might just make things worse.
1552212.title: Leave the Stone alone

choices: More shrinking and size based artifacts!
An artifact that causes other types of transformations
15522121.content:
You weren't about to scare that easily! You were a cat! And maybe you were still just a kitten... And maybe you were currently only six inches tall... But you were still a fierce brave feline! Not some kind of scaredy-cat! There had to be something else in this house you could use to try to get back to normal size. You'd just need to be a little more careful as you explore so as not to step on anything again.

Given your current stature, that shouldn't be to hard.

You slowly advanced across hole riddled boards, occasionally having to leap across a board to keep going. You were back in the foyer, and trying to decide where to go next. You looked to your right, seeing the old decrepit stares again. Perhaps you'd look up on the second floor last.


Then again... With your luck, if there was something in this house that could change you back... It'd be in the biggest pain in the butt place to get to... Meaning somewhere upstairs.

It was totally gonna be upstairs.

You sighed, and quickly ran to the steps. Each step was taller than you were by about a head. Luckily, cat, so climbing was kind of what you were best at. Bringing out your claws, it was easy to climb right up over the first step with no problem. And with the first step out of the way... There were only about 29 more steps to go. This... This was going to take a bit.

Step by step, you climbed up. Even at this small size, you felt like the stairs could give out beneath you any moment. Much of what was left of them was made of rotting wood, and there were more than a few holes. Perhaps your small size was a bit of a blessing here. Weighing so little you weren't actually at a huge risk... But you'd have to make sure once you were back to normal sized you were careful on the way down.

Finally, you reached the top of the steps, feeling somewhat fatigued, but determined to move on. You were now in a long hallway with doors lining each side. All of them were closed, but with as bad a condition as this place was you were fairly confident you could find a way into each of them. It was time to start exploring these rooms one by one till you found what you were looking for. But who knew what the next artifact you found would be.
15522121.title: Explore the House in Search of Artifacts

15522122.content:
You didn't know what else could happen here, but you weren't waiting to find out. If you stuck around you might wind up flea sized or turned some kind of freaky hairless ape. You ran as quick as you could for the front door. There was no possible way for you to get it open again, but the rotting wood had left a hole underneath it just big enough for you to squirm under. You ran on, leaping down the front steps, a task that proved to be somewhat terrifying once you realized it felt like a ten foot drop! Luckily, cats landed on their feet, and you were no exception. Though, you were surprised how light the impact was.

You went down the other two steps slightly slower... Hanging on to the top of a step with your paws as you slowly lowered yourself down. Once back down on the ground you resumed running to distance yourself from the house.

You were soon lost in grass nearly as tall as you were. If you stood on the tips of your toes you could just barely see over it. It was like a jungle out here! Maybe inside the house had been safer. Still, at least you could kind of see which way you were going, and after running around in the grass for ten minutes eventually reached a sidewalk. Of course, it was gigantic now, each slab as wide as an entire house.

How far was your home from here again? About six blocks?

You looked off into the distance, the sidewalk a giant concrete desert seeming to stretch forever. It... It was going to be a long walk home. But what else were you going to do?

Now a little calmer, you moved on. Having had time to adjust, it was kind of amazing to see the world from the vantage. Street lights shot up into the sky higher than you could see, dandelions were big enough to climb, and a discarded cup looked like a cave. Actually... It was kind of fun. The world was like a giant playground.

And mere moments after thinking that, an ear splitting roar erupted near you, as something impossibly large screamed pass on the right.You let out a yeowl as your eats flattened and the fur of your tail puffed up! What kind of horrible demon was that!? Spinning in place frantically, you saw the source of the noise. It was just a car that had passed you by on the road. However, it had looked like some kind of enormous steel monster and sounded like the devil himself! For a moment you would have thought you were being attacked by Godzilla before it was far enough away for you to make out the whole shape.

This drove home how small you were again... And suddenly you felt very vulnerable standing there naked on the sidewalk. What if someone was walking by, didn't even see you and stepped on you! That would be a rather embarassing way to go. Maybe you should move into the grass and-

"What was that scream?"

Your ears perked up as you heard a voice, it was one you actually recognized... A classmate from your school, and they were coming up right behind you. You turned around to see...
15522122.title: Escape the house before anything else happens!

155221221.content:
You felt a shadow fall over you as the source of the voice came near, and turning around you found yourself facing a pair of giant black paws. Craning your neck up, you saw as it shifted to a more orange color as you made out the shape of the enormous behemoth that stood before you.


His name was Christopher, but you usually just called him Chris, and he was a fox that was in the same class as you. Actually, you had known him since kindergarten. Technically, Chris was your best friend. But you preferred thinking of him as a rival! You were just rivals who hate lunch together, had sleepovers together, attended each other's birthday parties and well... Okay, maybe if you had to testify under oath, you'd admit you were really fond of him as a friend... But admitting things like that out loud just wasn't the type of relationship you two had. And now that relationship had a new dynamic now that he was absolutely giant compared to you.

He had always been a bit bigger than you, usually by a head, but now he stood over you like a titan. As he saw you, he crouched down to get a better look at you, making it easier for you to make out most of his features. Right now, he was dressed in simple pair of green jogging shorts and nothing else. It made sense, he ran track at school and you had seen him out running like this several times to stay in shape. You supposed you should be happy he had noticed you before stepping on you.

"That yowl sounded like..." Chris muttered as hie eyes grew wide when he recognized your small shape. He said your name with a laugh, as his giant tail began to wag behind him. "What the heck happened to you?" He fell back onto his bottom and fell into a fit of giggles. "You look like a mouse! And wear are your clothes!?"

"It's not funny!" You hissed and stamped a paw. In truth, despite his reaction, you were happy to see a friendly face. He might be able to help get you home a lot faster... Especially since you both lived in the same neighborhood. But... You weren't about to ask for help while he was having a laugh at you.

"I'm sorry! It's just..." Chris took a deep breath as he sat up properly. "Seriously, why are you so small?"

"It's..." You thought back to the house, and the strange stone that had shrunk you. Suddenly, you had something of a wicked thought, that if you lured Chris into the house, he might suffer the same fate as you! That'd teach him to laugh at you! Though... Then again that would make getting home harder... But at least there would be two of you to work together.

You were interrupted from your thoughts as you suddenly felt something punch your tail. Chris had grabbed it between two fingers and lifted you up into the air.

"MROOOOOOOOOAWRL!" You let out a screech. "Put me down!"

"Ah come on, when am I gonna get a chance like this again?" Chris asked as he let you swing back and forth for a bit while you squirmed. After a few moments of this, he set you down in his other paw and held you up to face level so you could talk easier. "But seriously, what happened?"

"Well..." You had to consider how you went about this here. Being full sized, Chris could explore the house easier than you to look for an artifact that could change you back... Of course, you could also try to get him shrunk too... And that might even make him more motivated to help you.

Of course, there was no guarantee there was any magic in that house that could change you back, and going back in might be risking all kinds of chaos for both of you. Maybe it'd be best if you were a little evasive for now and just asked him to take you home.
155221221.title: A big friend

choices: Warn him about the shrinking stone
Keep quiet and let what happens happen
1552212211.content:
You decided to tell Chris about the house. Sure, the two of you were contractually obligated to give each other a hard time, but when push came to shove, the two of you would help each other out. Though, maybe not before causing a bit of mischief.

"Okay... So... Here's what happened. You know that old house we've been told since we were little to never, ever, ever go into under any circumstances."

"Yeah?" Chris tilted his head and looked down at you.

"Yeah, I sort of went in there... And uh... Well you know all those playground rumors about how that place is cursed and full of strange magical artifacts well..." You gestured at your own tiny body. "Turns out, it's true! And one of them did this to me!"

"You know, if you weren't currently able to fit into the palm of my hand I'd accuse you of trying to pull one over on me." Chris squinted. "But given current evidence, regardless of how farfetched it sounds I think I can take your words at face value." That was good, it would have been difficult had he chosen not to believe you. "So... What now? Are you just stuck like that?"

"Maybe..." You thought to yourself. "But... Maybe not! I mean... If something in the house could shrink me, it only makes sense there might be something else that could change me back!"

"So... Why are you out here rather than back in the house?" Chris asked.

"Because right now I'm barely bigger than a mouse!" You threw your paws up in the air. "That place is huge! It'd take forever for me to go through it on my own!"

"So you need help." Chris grinned. "And now you're about to ask me?"

'"Well... Yes..." You muttered.

"Okay, fair, fair." Chris nodded. "You do seem to have a tiny little predicament. I feel like a really bad friend if I ignored your little problem. I mean, I wouldn't want you to think that I think that little of you."

"Stop saying little." You muttered.

"Alright, alright fine! I won't say little, I wouldn't want to do anything to make you feel small." He grinned.

"You're just enjoying this." You muttered.

"Absolutely." His smile somehow widened. "I mean, I'm going to help! But... What are the odds I'll ever get a chance like this again?"Despite his tone, he tend seem like he was ready to help. He slowly lifted you up to the top of his head and let you perch up there while he moved forward. You stepped off his paw grabbed the side of one of his now giant ears to steady yourself as you knelt down and made yourself comfortable. His fur was actually really soft... In fact, hanging out here was almost pleasant. "Of course, you're going to owe me big after this. Alright... Let's head to the old house."

It took Chris much less time to get to the house than it had taken you to make your way here. That made sense. Every 50 steps for you was only one step for him. Before too long, you found yourself in the familiar decaying house where this had started. Chris became a little slower here... And though you knew he'd never admit it, you could feel his fur standing on end around you. It was clear this creepy old manor got to him a bit.

"So... Where exactly do we start looking?" Chris spoke somewhat hesitantly. "I mean... I don't even know what a magical artifact looks like."

"Neither did I till I walked into one..." You muttered as you remembered the item that shrunk you had simply been a smooth black stone. You hadn't even noticed it, just stepped on it while looking around.

"Hey I found your clothes!" Chris pointed at the discarded shorts and shirt that lay on the floor not too far outside the foyer. He began to stroll towards them, and his mood seemed to lighten as he suddenly came up with new ways to tease you. "You know... This may be the first time I thought your britches were too big for you instead of the other way around."

"Oh ha haaaaa." You growled.

A thought occurred to you at this point. It was pretty dimly lit in here, and as a cat your night vision was far superior to Chris' and yet even you hadn't seen the small black stone until you stepped on it. Unless you warned him, he'd probably stumble right over it himself while investigating your clothes. You -should- probably say something.

But of course... He had been giving you a hard time for a bit. If he found himself cut down to size a bit, it might make him a little more understanding. Of course, that'd make the house a lot harder to explore to look for a way to reverse it... But at least there would be two of you working together, and that made you feel a bit braver.

He was just a few steps away from your old clothes, if you didn't say something soon it'd be too late.
1552212211.title: Tell him about the house

choices: Chris and you were both 6 inches tall
You guet shrunk smaller than the 6 inch tall Chris
15522122112.content:
Chris' teasing was getting to you a bit, especially since there was nothing you could do right now to get back at him. So... You decided to stay quiet about the stone. Sure, getting around the house was going to be harder... But hey, you were two clever kids, you could come up with something.

"Guess it was pretty unlucky your clothes didn't shrink huh?" Chris was still chattering away. "Don't know which must be more embarrassing, being tiny or being naked. I mean... Not like we haven't seen each other naked before... Granted we were two years old last time but still and-" He paused. "Wait I think I just stepped on something... Your underwear was half covering it so I didn't see it and..."

You suddenly felt yourself fall slightly downward, the reason was obvious. Chris was shrinking now.

"Um... So... I think I found what shrunk you..." Chris suddenly sounded very nervous. The fox was shrinking. You could feel him getting smaller beneath you. As he did, it was becoming harder to maintain your perch atop his head. His jogging shorts quickly fell down around his ankles, leaving him as naked as you as he quickly dwindled in size. After a few seconds, it was soon impossible for you to keep your balance as you tumbled off of him falling to the floor.

You had a sudden moment of panic. If you landed on the stone, you might shrink even smaller! Maybe this wasn't the best of plans...

In the end...
15522122112.title: Keep quiet and let what happens happen

choices: Tell Randy about the houses and the stone
Insist everythign is fine, despite your shrunken status
155221222.content:
When you turned around, you found yourself facing one of the few students in your class who was still smaller than you.

Randy. He wasn't someone you had ever really hung out with before... Mostly because he was a mouse, and you were a cat. Ignoring the obvious tensions that came from that, you were just several times his size and so hanging out would have just not been that practical. Or at least... You used to be. You were still bigger... But instead of being about the size of one of your paws the mouse was now level with your chest.

The mouse wasn't wearing much, then again most mice didn't. They less owned clothes, and more scraps and cloths they had managed to snag from something bigger. Right now, Randy was only wearing a simple blue cloth tied around his waste as a makeshift loincloth that ended just above his knees. Other than that, his brown fur was completely uncovered, leaving him mostly naked.

Which left him slightly more dressed than you were.

As you saw the mouse's eyes widen as he stared at you, your ears flattened again as you felt yourself blush beneath your fur. It was bad enough to be seen like this by someone at school? But by a mouse? You'd never live this town.

Randy called your name.

"Is... That really you?" He grinned slightly. "What... Happened? You're so... Small!" He suddenly bounced around you, studying your diminutive body all over. He paused as he noticed your still puffed up tail. "Did something scare you?"

"N-no!" A new form of embarrassment took over, as you quickly licked one of your paws and began to rub your tail fur back down. Randy being a mouse, faced a giant world like this every single day. There was no way you were going to admit how terrified you had been! Anything a mouse could do, a cat could do just as easily! And that included living life from a lower viewpoint.

"Really... Cause... Your ears are flat against your head." Randy stuck his tongue out.

"A-are not!" You forced your ears upright and glared at the mouse.

"Easy... Easy..." Randy took a few steps back."So... Um... Seriously... What happened? And... Are you aware you're currently naked?"

"Yes! It's fine!" You hissed without thinking. "And..." You paused and glanced back in the direction the house was in. There was still the possibility of something in there that could change you back... And as much as you'd hate to admit it, Randy could be a big help. He was already used to this giant world, and could easily show you how to navigate the enormous house without getting hurt. Plus... Having someone in there with you would make you feel a little braver.

But of course, that would involve admitting you needed help. And as a kitten, you had a certain amount of stubborn pride. This was not a good time for it, but it was there.
155221222.title: A small friend

info.brief_description: all types of furry stuff in here!
info.description:
Basicaly you are a male human turned into a furry (or anthro, whatever you feel like.) and put through various changes to your person.
should you manage to escape the lab, you find the world seems to think your alterations are 'normal'.
Reality can also be changed so that you always were a furry.
